remarks: A shorter sum of nonnegative terms is smaller than a longer one. (Contributed by NM, 26-Dec-2005.)  (Proof shortened by Mario Carneiro, 24-Apr-2014.)
statement:
fsumge0.1 $e |- ( ph -> A e. Fin ) $.
fsumge0.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> B e. RR ) $.
fsumge0.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ k e. A ) -> 0 <_ B ) $.
fsumless.4 $e |- ( ph -> C C_ A ) $.
fsumless $p |- ( ph -> sum_ k e. C B <_ sum_ k e. A B ) $.
$d A k $.
$d C k $.
$d k ph $.
